{"handle": "developer-dao", "community_addon": {"id": "1mcnhy", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"DevDAO Funding Guidelines\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"*Updated June 28, 2024*\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nWelcome! If you have a project that improves the NEAR developer experience, DevDAO may be able to provide funding.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## About DevDAO\\\\\\\\nDevDAO is the primary organization behind DevHub. Our mission is to build a thriving, self-sufficient NEAR developer community by focusing on developer onboarding and engagement.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Areas of Funding\\\\\\\\nWe support initiatives that make it easier for developers to get started with NEAR, engage with the community, and contribute successfully. Example areas:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevTools**: SDKs, CLIs, IDEs, and documentation (Rust and JS stacks) that streamline development.\\\\\\\\n* **DevRel**: Activities that onboard and engage developers including tutorials, guides, onboarding experiences, community support channels, and IRL/online events.\\\\\\\\n* **DevHub Portal**: Creating essential tools for managing proposals, treasury, and community collaboration.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Evaluation Criteria\\\\\\\\nWe want to fund projects that positively impact the NEAR developer journey. Here\\\\\\'s what we look for:\\\\\\\\n* **Developer First**: We strongly support proposals that prioritize the needs of developers and help growth and retain the number of active developers on NEAR. Show us how your solution will make it easy for developers to succeed, whether through tools, libraries, education, or other initiatives.\\\\\\\\n* **Open Source**: Not all proposals require code, but they should follow the spirit of knowledge sharing and collaboration.\\\\\\\\n* **Public Good**: We want to see clear benefits to the NEAR & broader community.\\\\\\\\n* **Execution Ability**: Demonstrate your ability to to deliver by sharing your team\\\\u{2019}s track record of success and available resources.\\\\\\\\n* **Clear Use of Funds**: We expect to carefully consider the factors that influence your funding amount request and present clearly how the funding will enable your goals.\\\\\\\\n \\\\\\\\n## Funding Journey\\\\\\\\nThe funding of projects is a collaborative and transparent effort between the applicant, various Work Groups in the NEAR developer community, and the DevDAO Moderators. It involves the key stages below.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 1: Draft\\\\\\\\nThe proposal life cycle begins when an author submits a draft. During the draft stage, the proposal is open for community comments and the author can still make changes and build consensus.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Get Started**: To submit a draft, navigate to the [/proposals](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposals) feed page and click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"New Proposal.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" It is a good idea to browse other proposals to learn from previous efforts and consider how your proposal differs from or builds upon existing ideas. \\\\\\\\n* **Fill Out Your Draft**: Complete these required fields:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Category: Select the category that best aligns with your project or contribution.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Title: Craft a concise and descriptive title that captures the essence of your proposal in a few words. This will appear on your proposal\\\\u{2019}s detail page and the main proposal feed. Keep it short, please. (e.g., \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Streamlined Onboarding Tutorials for New NEAR Developers\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Summary: Briefly explain your proposal\\\\\\'s goals and the benefits it brings to the NEAR developer community. (Consider using a problem-solution approach: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Problem: New developers struggle to find clear onboarding resources. Solution: We propose creating interactive tutorials...\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\")\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Description: Expand on your summary with details like your contribution timeline, key milestones, team background, and a clear breakdown of how the funds will be used. Keep the description simple and easy to understand. Proposals should be simple and clear (e.g. 1 month). For more complex projects, treat each milestone as a separate proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t* Other Fields: Complete all other remaining fields, including KYC/KYB Verification, funding amount, currency preference, NEAR wallet address, requested sponsor, and consent to the Terms & Conditions and Code of Conduct.\\\\\\\\n* **Submit or Continue Editing**: Click \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Draft\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to post the draft to the community, or \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for review\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" if ready to start the official review process with DevDAO. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in draft mode. To edit the proposal, click Edit.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 2: Review\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **Move to Review**: Once you\\\\\\'re ready for DevDAO to review your proposal, change the status to \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Ready for Review.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" This moves your proposal to the review stage and locks the editing function, but comments are still open. After confirming the transaction, you will see your proposal in Review mode. At this point, DevDAO may consider reviewing your proposal. DevHub Community Managers review submitted proposals on a weekly cadence and request from the appropriate Work Groups or DevHub moderators to review. \\\\\\\\n* **Community Input**: Your proposal is open for discussion. Engage with the community, consider suggestions, and make any necessary adjustments based on feedback. \\\\\\\\n* **Sponsor Review**: DevDAO Moderators review submitted proposals on a regular cadence and may consult relevant working groups for input.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNote: If you wish to cancel your proposal, you can click Cancel Proposal. This changes the status to Canceled, signaling to DevDAO that it\\\\u{2019}s no longer active or relevant.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 3: Decision\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **DevDAO Evaluation** DevDAO Moderators consider community feedback, available budget, alignment with focus areas, and various other factors to make a collaborative decision. Once the DevDAO Moderators update the decision, they will add a comment to the sponsorship to indicate the decision & next steps. \\\\\\\\n* **Possible Decisions**: Approved, Approved (Conditional), Rejected, Canceled (by the author).\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 4: Payment Processing\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n* **KYC/KYB Verification**: If the proposal is approved, DevDAO Moderators will move the proposal to the Payment Processing stage and first verify that you have already completed KYC/KYB verification to ensure legal compliance.\\\\\\\\n* **Information Collection & Legal Steps (with NEAR Foundation)**: Once verified, DevDAO moderators will request for you to complete the following required steps with the NEAR Foundation:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t1. Complete the Funding Request using the Airtable form.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t2. Submit the final invoice after receiving an email from the NEAR Foundation finance team using Request Finance.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\t3. Confirm the test transaction after receiving a test transaction confirmation email from the NEAR Foundation finance team. \\\\\\\\n* **Payment Disbursement**: Typically, funds are disbursed within 10 business days, but timelines may vary.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Stage 5: Funded\\\\\\\\n* **Transparency**: Once funded, payment details are made public on the proposal page.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Need More Help?\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nIf you have further questions, please post a comment on the [DevHub Platform](https://near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=devhub-platform&tab=discussions) community.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Funding"}}

{"data": {"developer-dao.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Developer DAO", "tags": {"community": "", "announcements": "", "developer-dao": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreifg2kou37l4y4hxidkone5wxocctqmj6ygnbpjhyf2raxly7avtze"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao", "telegram": "NEARDevHub"}, "description": "We brings together individuals & organizations to build a decentralized NEAR developer ecosystem. We provide social structures and tools to empower anyone to contribute to the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihlecc5n2l2r6pstnvpmmnff7pfyc6iurfpps2peep32cruolgrt4"}}}, "discussions.developer-dao.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "Developer DAO (Community Discussions)", "tags": {"community": "", "discussions": "", "developer-dao": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreifg2kou37l4y4hxidkone5wxocctqmj6ygnbpjhyf2raxly7avtze"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao", "telegram": "NEARDevHub"}, "description": "Empowering a decentralized NEAR developer community\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=developer-dao).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihlecc5n2l2r6pstnvpmmnff7pfyc6iurfpps2peep32cruolgrt4"}}}}}

{"body": {"name": "DevHub (01 - 24 June) & DevRel (17 - 30 June) Contributor Report", "summary": "Bi-weekly paid developer relations contributor report. The aim of these activities is to onboard more developers to the ecosystem, and assist existing developers with problems or enrich their experience in the ecosystem. Activities for the last two weeks can be seen below.", "category": "Decentralized DevRel", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "##### 1. DevRel Contribution (supervised by @gagdiez.near)\\\\n\\\\n* Internal Meetings - weekly stand-up, 1-1 with team members (2h)\\\\n* [Bring functionality to Chain Abstraction example to sign transactions on Ethereum Contract](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain/pull/23) (16h)\\\\n* [Merge \\\\\\\"Concepts\\\\\\\" with \\\\\\\"Build\\\\\\\" on the doc page](https://github.com/near/docs/issues/2079) (6h) - the project is in progress at the moment\\\\n\\\\n**Timeline**\\\\nStart Date: 6/17/2024\\\\nEnd Date: 6/30/2024\\\\n\\\\n**Funding**\\\\nTotal hours: 24\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nAmount: $1.200 USD\\\\n\\\\n##### 2. DevHub Contribution (supervised by @frol.near)\\\\n\\\\n**Tooling Contribution (6 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* https://github.com/frol/bos-component-ts-starter/pull/14\\\\n* https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/bos-cli-rs/pull/94\\\\n\\\\n**Community Support (16 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* Responding to questions on StackOverflow and Telegram (1h)\\\\n* Livestream and meeting preparations, environment set up (6h)\\\\n* Mentorship\\\\n\\\\t * 1-on-1 Meetings (6h)\\\\n\\\\t * Code Review (3h)\\\\n\\\\n**Marketing & Retention (6 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* YouTube [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZQv-4tH8Dw) production (6h)\\\\n\\\\n**Other (2 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* Internal Meetings - 1-on-1 with team members\\\\n\\\\n**Timeline**\\\\nStart Date: 6/01/2024\\\\nEnd Date: 6/24/2024\\\\n\\\\n**Funding**\\\\nTotal hours: 30\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: $1.500 USD\\\\n\\\\n----------\\\\n\\\\n**Total funding**\\\\n$2.700 USD", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "denbite.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2700", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": []}

The aim of these activities is to onboard more developers to the ecosystem, and assist existing developers with problems or enrich their experience in the ecosystem. Activities for the last two weeks can be seen below.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=132)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

DevRel Contribution (supervised by @gagdiez.near)\\\\n\\\\n* Internal Meetings - weekly stand-up, 1-1 with team members (2h)\\\\n* [Bring functionality to Chain Abstraction example to sign transactions on Ethereum Contract](https://github.com/near-examples/near-multichain/pull/23) (16h)\\\\n* [Merge \\\\\\\"Concepts\\\\\\\" with \\\\\\\"Build\\\\\\\" on the doc page](https://github.com/near/docs/issues/2079) (6h) - the project is in progress at the moment\\\\n\\\\n**Timeline**\\\\nStart Date: 6/17/2024\\\\nEnd Date: 6/30/2024\\\\n\\\\n**Funding**\\\\nTotal hours: 24\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nAmount: $1.200 USD\\\\n\\\\n##### 2. DevHub Contribution (supervised by @frol.near)\\\\n\\\\n**Tooling Contribution (6 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* https://github.com/frol/bos-component-ts-starter/pull/14\\\\n* https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/bos-cli-rs/pull/94\\\\n\\\\n**Community Support (16 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* Responding to questions on StackOverflow and Telegram (1h)\\\\n* Livestream and meeting preparations, environment set up (6h)\\\\n* Mentorship\\\\n\\\\t * 1-on-1 Meetings (6h)\\\\n\\\\t * Code Review (3h)\\\\n\\\\n**Marketing & Retention (6 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* YouTube [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HZQv-4tH8Dw) production (6h)\\\\n\\\\n**Other (2 hours)**\\\\n\\\\n* Internal Meetings - 1-on-1 with team members\\\\n\\\\n**Timeline**\\\\nStart Date: 6/01/2024\\\\nEnd Date: 6/24/2024\\\\n\\\\n**Funding**\\\\nTotal hours: 30\\\\nRate: $50/hour\\\\nTotal amount: $1.500 USD\\\\n\\\\n----------\\\\n\\\\n**Total funding**\\\\n$2.700 USD", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "denbite.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2700", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "denbite.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "DevHub Developer Contributor report by Yurtur for 06/01/2024 \\\\u{2013} 06/30/2024", "summary": "Reducing nearcore common library crate sizes. Worked on the rollout of near 0.23 crates and apps.\\\\nFixed Windows compilation of near-crates", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "Total Hours: 68\\\\nHourly rate: $75/h\\\\nTotal: 5100 USD\\\\n\\\\n##### Reducing dependencies in nearcore crates - 44 hours \\\\n* [#11462](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11462) - reduce near-primitives dependencies from 358 to 218 compilation units - 12 hours\\\\n* [#11501](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11501) - add rust-analyzer to toolchain file 15 mins\\\\n* [#11597](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11597) - separated heavy dependencies into features for near-primitives (-23 crates on feature-less version) - 4 hours\\\\n* [#11578](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11578) - removed dependency on near-vm-runner for near-primitives. Fixed windows compilation. It took several iteration to create a proper version. - 2 days - 16 hours\\\\n* [#11639](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11639) - reduced dependencies for near-jsonrpc-primitives, near-chain-configs, near-chain-primitives, near-client-primitives, near-store - 12 hours\\\\n\\\\n##### 0.23 rollout - 16 hours in total\\\\n\\\\n###### near-ledger - 2 hours in total\\\\n* [#9](https://github.com/khorolets/near-ledger-rs/pull/9) - updated deps to 0.22\\\\n* [#10](https://github.com/khorolets/near-ledger-rs/pull/10) - release-plz CI\\\\n* [#12](https://github.com/khorolets/near-ledger-rs/pull/12) - updated deps to 0.23\\\\n\\\\n###### near-jsonrpc-client-rs - 2 hour in total\\\\n* [#145](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/pull/145) - updated deps to 0.22\\\\n* [#148](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/pull/148) - updated deps to 0.23\\\\n\\\\n###### near-socialdb-client - 2 hour in total\\\\n* [#7](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/7) - updated deps to 0.22\\\\n* [#9](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/9) - updated deps to 0.23\\\\n\\\\n###### near-cli-rs - 4 hours in total\\\\n* [#350](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/pull/350) - updated deps to 0.23. 0.22 release was stopped here as near-primitives couldn\\\\\\'t be compiled on Windows platform. This required fix from nearcore side that I have done in the [#11639](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11639). - 4 hours including windows issue investigation\\\\n\\\\n###### near-sdk-rs - 2 hours in total\\\\n* [#1207](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/1207) - updated deps to 0.23. 2 hours\\\\n\\\\n###### near-workspaces - 2 hour in total\\\\n* Investigation of required changes for 0.22 (that was stopped in favor of 0.23). \\\\n\\\\n###### cargo-near - 2 hours\\\\n* [#167](https://github.com/near/cargo-near/pull/167) - updated deps to 0.23.\\\\n\\\\n##### Non direct time consumption - 8 hours\\\\n* Discussion and syncing, code review discussion\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "yurtur.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5100", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": []}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Tooling & Infrastructure* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @yurtur.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}DevHub Developer Contributor report by Yurtur for 06/01/2024 \\\\u{2013} 06/30/2024\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nReducing nearcore common library crate sizes. Worked on the rollout of near 0.23 crates and apps.\\\\\\\\nFixed Windows compilation of near-crates\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=133)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 133, "snapshot": {"name": "DevHub Developer Contributor report by Yurtur for 06/01/2024 \\\\u{2013} 06/30/2024", "labels": [], "summary": "Reducing nearcore common library crate sizes. Worked on the rollout of near 0.23 crates and apps.\\\\nFixed Windows compilation of near-crates", "category": "Tooling & Infrastructure", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "yurtur.near", "timestamp": "1719821861740968021", "supervisor": "frol.near", "description": "Total Hours: 68\\\\nHourly rate: $75/h\\\\nTotal: 5100 USD\\\\n\\\\n##### Reducing dependencies in nearcore crates - 44 hours \\\\n* [#11462](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11462) - reduce near-primitives dependencies from 358 to 218 compilation units - 12 hours\\\\n* [#11501](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11501) - add rust-analyzer to toolchain file 15 mins\\\\n* [#11597](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11597) - separated heavy dependencies into features for near-primitives (-23 crates on feature-less version) - 4 hours\\\\n* [#11578](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11578) - removed dependency on near-vm-runner for near-primitives. Fixed windows compilation. It took several iteration to create a proper version. - 2 days - 16 hours\\\\n* [#11639](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11639) - reduced dependencies for near-jsonrpc-primitives, near-chain-configs, near-chain-primitives, near-client-primitives, near-store - 12 hours\\\\n\\\\n##### 0.23 rollout - 16 hours in total\\\\n\\\\n###### near-ledger - 2 hours in total\\\\n* [#9](https://github.com/khorolets/near-ledger-rs/pull/9) - updated deps to 0.22\\\\n* [#10](https://github.com/khorolets/near-ledger-rs/pull/10) - release-plz CI\\\\n* [#12](https://github.com/khorolets/near-ledger-rs/pull/12) - updated deps to 0.23\\\\n\\\\n###### near-jsonrpc-client-rs - 2 hour in total\\\\n* [#145](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/pull/145) - updated deps to 0.22\\\\n* [#148](https://github.com/near/near-jsonrpc-client-rs/pull/148) - updated deps to 0.23\\\\n\\\\n###### near-socialdb-client - 2 hour in total\\\\n* [#7](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/7) - updated deps to 0.22\\\\n* [#9](https://github.com/bos-cli-rs/near-socialdb-client-rs/pull/9) - updated deps to 0.23\\\\n\\\\n###### near-cli-rs - 4 hours in total\\\\n* [#350](https://github.com/near/near-cli-rs/pull/350) - updated deps to 0.23. 0.22 release was stopped here as near-primitives couldn\\\\\\'t be compiled on Windows platform. This required fix from nearcore side that I have done in the [#11639](https://github.com/near/nearcore/pull/11639). - 4 hours including windows issue investigation\\\\n\\\\n###### near-sdk-rs - 2 hours in total\\\\n* [#1207](https://github.com/near/near-sdk-rs/pull/1207) - updated deps to 0.23. 2 hours\\\\n\\\\n###### near-workspaces - 2 hour in total\\\\n* Investigation of required changes for 0.22 (that was stopped in favor of 0.23). \\\\n\\\\n###### cargo-near - 2 hours\\\\n* [#167](https://github.com/near/cargo-near/pull/167) - updated deps to 0.23.\\\\n\\\\n##### Non direct time consumption - 8 hours\\\\n* Discussion and syncing, code review discussion\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "yurtur.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "5100", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "author_id": "yurtur.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}
